, an Israeli company, C.N. 51-626615-2, whose address is at 30 Ibn Gabirol Tel Aviv, Israel
, with its principal place of business at
[_30 Ibn gvirol street Tel Aviv Israel_]
The parties herein may be referred to individually as a "
Service Provider has been selected by Company to provide certain Services, all as further described in this Agreement.
in consideration of the mutual covenants set forth below, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows:

" means, with respect to either Party, any person, organization or entity controlling, controlled by, or under common control with, such Party, where "control" means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person, organization or entity, whether through the ownership of voting securities or by contract or otherwise.

" means the deliverables, work product, and other Intellectual Property invented, authored, and/or otherwise developed pursuant to this Agreement, regardless of inventorship or authorship. For the avoidance of doubt, "Deliverables" shall also be deemed to include (as applicable in relation to the Deliverable in question) the corresponding fully documented human-readable source code, programmer notes, and all other information to allow a reasonably skilled programmer, developer, or designer to understand the design, logic, structure, sequence, functionality, operation and features of the Deliverable, and to manufacture, use, operate, maintain, modify, and support the Deliverable.

" means any and all rights, titles, and interests (under any jurisdiction or treaty, whether protectable or not, whether registered or unregistered, and whether vested, contingent, or future) in and to inventions, discoveries, improvements, works of authorship, technical information, data, technology, know-how, show-how, designs, drawings, formulas, methods, processes, databases, computer software and programs (including without limitation object code, source code, and non-literal aspects), algorithms, architecture, and other similar intellectual property or technology, in any form and embodied in any media (collectively, "

"), and includes without limitation patents, copyright and similar authorship rights, personal rights (such as Moral Rights, rights of privacy, and publicity rights), location (and similar geography-based) rights, mask work rights, trade secret and similar confidentiality rights, design rights, industrial property rights, trademark, trade name, trade dress and similar branding rights, as well as: (a) all applications, registrations, renewals, extensions, continuations, continuations-in-part, divisions or reissues of the foregoing rights; and (b) all goodwill associated with the foregoing rights.
" means the design, development, and related services, as further described in

. Service Provider represents and warrants that: (A) the Services shall be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, and by qualified workers experienced in performing the type of work contemplated; (B) each Deliverable shall be an original work of authorship, and no Deliverable shall infringe, misappropriate, or violate any third party's rights; (C) it has good and marketable title to the Deliverables provided, free and clear of any and all security interests, liens, claims, charges or other encumbrances; and (D) no Deliverable shall include any virus, time bomb, worm, Trojan horse, disabling device, automatic restraint, or similar program or device designed to impede or harm Company's use of its systems, Confidential Information, or Deliverables.
. The Services will be provided by Services Provider through its employees pre-approved by Company, in the roles specified in

"). If Service Provider is interested in changing any Supplier Representatives, it will have to provide the Company with the names of the alternative Supplier Representatives, along with details of his/her qualifications. The Company has absolute discretion to grant such approval or to refuse the Service Provider's request. The Company will be entitled to demand the replacement of Supplier Representatives, at Company's sole discretion and without the need for justification, and Service Provider shall replace them according to the Company's request within 10 days of receiving a Company written notice. Company is free, at any time, to contract with other service providers for services that are the same as, or similar to, any Services. Service Provider shall not be entitled to subcontract pursuant to this Agreement, without Company's prior express written consent. For the avoidance of doubt, any acts and omissions of Supplier Representatives or approved subcontractors shall be deemed the acts and omissions of Service Provider, and Service Provider shall remain primarily liable and responsible for the acts and omissions of Supplier Representatives and such subcontractors as fully as if they were the acts and omissions of Service Provider itself.

. If Company requests in writing a significant change to the scope of Services, Service Provider will promptly notify Company in writing if Service Provider believes that additional Fees may be necessary, but Service Provider will not perform such additional Services without the Parties executing a written addendum to this Agreement. Unless Company requests a significant change to the scope of the Services, Service Provider will not charge additional Fees, even if Service Provider requires additional work hours to complete the Services and deliver a Deliverable.
. In consideration for Service Provider's performance hereunder, Company shall (subject to receipt of an appropriate tax invoice) pay Service Provider the fees set forth in
"), which shall be calculated, invoiced and paid pursuant to the terms and conditions set forth in such

. The Fees represent the sole consideration to which Service Provider is entitled for performance under this Agreement, and Service Provider shall not be entitled to, and hereby irrevocably waives, any claim for additional consideration for overtime, royalties, expense reimbursement, or any other payment with respect to performance hereunder and/or any Deliverable.

. Company may deduct and/or withhold taxes, if any, from payments to Service Provider where required under applicable law. Service Provider shall be responsible for any sales, service, value-added, use, excise, consumption and any other taxes and duties on the goods or services he purchases, consumes or uses in performing the Services or providing Deliverables.

. Company shall be entitled to deduct from and set off against amounts due to the Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement and/or pursuant to any other agreement, law, or otherwise, any amounts that: (a) the Service Provider is required to pay or return to Company pursuant to this Agreement, any other agreement, any law, or otherwise; and/or (b) any amounts that Company may have overpaid to Service Provider in prior periods or invoices.

. Each Deliverable is deemed a "work made for hire" (for copyright purposes, whether under US Copyright law or any analogous law or concept in other jurisdictions) made for Company. All right, title, and interest (including without limitation all Intellectual Property Rights) in and to all Deliverables, as well as (regardless of inventorship or authorship) any improvements, derivatives, and/or modifications thereof/to (collectively, the "

"), shall be owned exclusively by Company. To the extent any Deliverable IPR does not vest automatically in Company upon development or creation, Service Provider hereby irrevocably assigns (and shall procure the assignment of) such Deliverable IPR to Company (as well as its designees, successors, and assigns). To the extent applicable law prevents future assignments, Service Provider shall assign (and shall procure the assignment of) such Deliverable IPR as they are developed or created. Service Provider undertakes to do all things reasonably requested by Company Party (including without limitation executing, filing, and delivering instruments) to perfect Company's ownership of Deliverable IPR. For the avoidance of doubt, Deliverable shall be deemed Confidential Information of Company.
Use of Background or Third Party IP
. No Deliverable shall incorporate, link to, utilize, or embody any Service Provider-owned Intellectual Property ("
"), except to the extent specifically requested and approved in writing by Company. No Deliverable shall incorporate, link to, utilize, or embody any third party Intellectual Property ("

"), except to the extent the specifically requested and approved in writing by Company. To the extent Background IP and/or Third Party IP is permitted or has been approved in connection with such Deliverable, under no circumstances shall such Background IP or Third Party IP consist of Open Source Software (defined below), unless such Open Source Software is specifically approved in writing. "

" shall mean any software that requires as a condition of use, modification and/or distribution that such software or other software incorporated into, derived from, or distributed with such software, be: (i) disclosed or distributed in source code form, (ii) licensed for the purpose of making derivative works, and/or (iii) redistributable at no charge. For the avoidance of doubt, but without limitation, software licensed under the GNU GPL, GNU LGPL, GNU AGPL, Server Side Public License (SSPL), Eclipse Public License (EPL), and/or the Mozilla Public License, are Open Source Software.

Regardless of whether any such aforesaid permissions or approvals are granted, to the extent any Deliverable incorporates, links to, utilizes, or embodies any Background IP or Third Party IP, Service Provider hereby grants (and shall procure for) each of Company and its Affiliates a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, paid-up, irrevocable, perpetual, sublicensable (through multiple tiers) right and license to reproduce, make, have made, use, distribute, sell, offer for sale, import, adapt, modify, create derivative works of, publicly perform, publicly display, and otherwise commercially exploit such Background IP and Third Party IP (as applicable) solely as so incorporated in, linked to, utilized by, or embodied in such Deliverable.

. To the extent that, pursuant to applicable law, Moral Rights in and to any Deliverables are incapable of vesting in or being assigned to Company, Service Provider hereby irrevocably waives and covenants never to assert any such Moral Rights (as defined below). "

" means any rights of paternity or integrity, any right to claim authorship of a work, to object to any distortion, mutilation or other modification of, or other derogatory action in relation to, any work, whether or not such would be prejudicial to the honor or reputation of the creator of the work, and any similar right, existing under judicial or statutory law of any jurisdiction, or under any treaty (and which may be known as or referred to as “moral rights,” “artist’s rights,” “droit moral,” or the like, and includes without limitation the rights of an author under Section 45 of the Israeli Copyright Law, 2007).

The Service Provider may have access to certain non-public information of the Company, in any form or media, including without limitation trade secrets and other information related to the products, software, technology, data, know-how, or business of the Company, and any other information that a reasonable person should have reason to believe is proprietary, confidential, or competitively sensitive (the “

”). The Service Provider shall take reasonable measures, at least as protective as those taken to protect its own confidential information, but in no event less than reasonable care, to protect the Company's Confidential Information from disclosure to a third party. The Service Provider’s obligations under this Section, with respect to any Confidential Information of the Company, shall not apply to and/or shall terminate if such information: (a) was already lawfully known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure by the Service Provider; (b) was disclosed to the Service Provider by a third party who had the right to make such disclosure without any confidentiality restrictions; (c) is, or through no fault of the receiving party has become, generally available to the public; or (d) was independently developed by the Service Provider without access to, or use of, the Confidential Information. The Service Provider shall not use or disclose the Confidential Information of the Company except for performance of its obligations under this Agreement (“

”). The Service Provider shall only permit access to the Confidential Information to its respective employees, consultants, affiliates, agents and subcontractors having a need to know such information in connection with the Permitted Use, who either (i) have signed a non-disclosure agreement with the Service Provider containing terms at least as restrictive as those contained herein or (ii) are otherwise bound by a duty of confidentiality to the Service Provider at least as restrictive as the terms set forth herein (collectively, "

"). The Service Provider shall remain primarily responsible and liable for any acts and omissions of its Representatives in respect of the Confidential Information, as fully as if they were the acts and omissions of the receiving party itself. The Service Provider will be allowed to disclose Confidential Information to the extent that such disclosure is required by law or by the order or a court of similar judicial or administrative body, provided that it notifies the Company of such required disclosure to enable Company to seek a protective order or otherwise prevent or restrict such disclosure. All right, title and interest in and to Confidential Information are and shall remain the sole and exclusive property of the Company.
. This Agreement commences on the Effective Date and shall continue in full force and effect until terminated in accordance herewith (the "
. Company may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Service Provider if Service Provider breaches this Agreement.

. Each Party may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon at least fourteen (14) days' prior written notice to the other Party, provided however, that the Service Provider may not terminate the Agreement prior to finalization of all outstanding SOW’s.

. Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any rights or obligations that accrued as of the effective date of termination. Upon the effective date of termination, Service Provider shall cease performance of the Services and deliver to Company all Deliverables (whether complete or work-in-progress), and shall issue to Company a pro-rated refund of any prepaid but unutilized Fees in respect of the month in which termination takes effect.
The following shall survive termination of this Agreement: (i) any provision and/or right that is stated, or that by its nature is contemplated, to survive termination; and (ii) Sections ‎‎4
Service Provider shall indemnify and hold harmless Company, its Affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents (each, an "
") from any and all losses, liabilities, damages, and related costs and expenses (including without limitation reasonable legal fees), interest and penalties (collectively, "
"), due to, arising from, or relating to any fraud, gross negligence, willful misconduct, and/or breach hereunder by Service Provider.

The Service Provider wishes the Services to be provided on an independent contractor-client basis via the Supplier Representatives and not on an employer-employee relationship basis. Accordingly, the relationship of the Parties shall be solely that of independent contractors, and no employer-employee, principal-agent, joint venture, outsourcing, franchise, partnership, or other relationship shall exist between the Company and either of the Service Provider or the Supplier Representatives. Service Provider shall ensure that the Supplier Representatives do not hold themselves out as employees, agents, or representatives of Company. Neither Party has any authority to enter into an agreement of any kind on behalf of the other Party, and neither Party will create or attempt to create any obligation, express or implied, on behalf of the other Party. Service Provider (on behalf of itself and all Supplier Representatives) hereby releases and forever discharges Company and its Affiliates from any and all claims, which Service Provider ever had, now has, or may claim to have, against Company and/or its Affiliates in connection with the existence of any employer-employee relationship between Company or such Affiliates on the one hand, and the Service Provider and/or Supplier Representatives on the other hand. It is hereby clarified that any right granted to Company to instruct and/or oversee the Services by the Supplier Representatives is granted in order to ensure the performance of the Services in full, and not to imply or justify an employer-employee relationship between Company or its Affiliates on the one hand, and the Service Provider and/or Supplier Representatives on the other hand. It is hereby clarified that it is the intention of the Parties that the Supplier Representatives will not transfer to be employees of the Company. Neither Service Provider nor any Supplier Representatives are eligible to participate in any of Company's or its Affiliates' employee benefit plans, fringe benefit programs, group insurance arrangements, or similar programs. Company and its Affiliates will not (and will not be obligated to) provide workers compensation, disability insurance, social security/national insurance, unemployment compensation coverage, or any other statutory benefit to Service Provider or any Supplier Representatives. Service Provider alone will be responsible: (a) for the payments of all taxes applicable to it as an independent contractor; and (b) to pay any and all payments, salary, wages, taxes, office space, equipment, utilities and all other benefits (including without limitation any amounts due to any relevant social security or national insurance body) with respect to Supplier Representatives and/or any Deliverables. Service Provider will be liable for any employment-related claim, or any claim based on worker status (including costs and expenses), brought by any Supplier Representative against the Company arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, and Service Provider shall indemnify and hold harmless Company and its Affiliates and personnel, from and against all claims of any Supplier Representative or a tax authority or other third party relating to salary owed, any income tax or other withholding obligations, social security, unemployment or disability insurance or similar fringe benefits all above in connection with compensation paid or payable to any Supplier Representative.

This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of Israel without regard to its conflicts of law rules and principles. Any claim, dispute or controversy between the Parties shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts located in Tel Aviv-Jaffa, Israel. Notwithstanding the foregoing, equitable relief may be sought at any time in any court of competent jurisdiction.

. This Agreement represents the entire agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersedes and replaces all prior and contemporaneous oral or written understandings and statements by the Parties with respect to such subject matter. Any terms or conditions – whether  printed, hyperlinked, or otherwise – in any invoice or other standardized business forms exchanged between the Parties, which purport to modify, supplement, or supersede this Agreement, shall be void and of no effect. This Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which together shall constitute one instrument. This Agreement may only be amended by an instrument in writing duly signed by each Party. The section and subsection headings used in this Agreement are for convenience only.
. Service Provider shall not use the name or logo of Company, or otherwise issue any publicity regarding this Agreement, without the prior express written consent of Company.
Any goodwill arising from use of the foregoing shall inure solely to the benefit of Company.

. Neither this Agreement (nor any rights or obligations) may be assigned by Service Provider without the prior express written consent of Company. Company may assign this Agreement (as well as any rights and obligations) without restriction or obligation. Any prohibited assignment shall be null and void. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement shall bind and benefit each Party and its respective successors and assigns.

. If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, then: (a) the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect; and (b) the Parties hereto agree that the court making such determination shall have the power to limit the provision, to delete specific words or phrases, or to replace the provision with a provision that is legal, valid and enforceable and that most closely approximates the original legal intent and economic impact of such provision, and this Agreement shall be enforceable as so modified in respect of such jurisdiction. In the event such court does not exercise the power granted to it as aforesaid, then such provision shall be ineffective solely as to such jurisdiction, and shall be substituted (in respect of such jurisdiction) with a valid, legal and enforceable provision that most closely approximates the original legal intent and economic impact of such provision.

. Except as may be expressly stated otherwise in this Agreement, all notices, consents, or other communications provided for in connection with this Agreement shall be in writing, and shall be deemed given upon: (a) personal delivery; (b) the second business day after mailing via either U.S. mail or mailing via registered or certified mail with postage prepaid and return receipt requested; (c) upon delivery confirmation by nationally recognized overnight delivery service ("
"); (d) the second business day after sending confirmed by facsimile; (e) the first business day after sending by email.

. No failure or delay on the part of either Party in exercising any right or remedy hereunder shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any such right or remedy preclude any other or further exercise thereof, or the exercise of any other right or remedy. Any waiver granted hereunder must be in a writing, duly signed by the waiving Party, and shall be valid only in the specific instance in which given. Except as may be expressly provided otherwise in this Agreement, no right or remedy conferred upon or reserved by either Party under this Agreement is intended to be, or shall be deemed, exclusive of any other right or remedy under this Agreement, at law, or in equity, but shall be cumulative of such other rights and remedies.

. Except may be as expressly stated otherwise in this Agreement, each Party shall pay its own costs and expenses incurred in connection with the negotiation, preparation, signature and performance of this Agreement (and any documents referred to in it). Service Provider shall be solely responsible for obtaining and maintaining any authorizations, approvals, licenses, certifications, permits, and/or consents required to perform the Services and provide the Deliverables.
, Company and Service Provider have caused this Agreement to be executed by their respective duly authorized officers or representatives as of the Effective Date.
Service proposal for branding, website design and brand material kit.
Create brand identity for “Clawdia” brand, this service includes:
-Competitors landscape and brand archetype research (5 hrs)
-Logo design, 3-4 logo drafts inlined with the competitors research and based on the brand story/language (45 hrs)
-Basic graphic language: Color palettes and meaning, logo meaning, logo construction, logo implementations for each proposal (15)
Time estimation: 60 work hours; Scope of hours:
hours per week of Brand Identity services.
-creation of website wireframes and layout with “grey design” for the specified web pages, this will be the base layout for the website design
Time estimation: 20 work hours; Scope of hours:
hours per week of Website Wireframing and Specification services.
Website Design with the following sections
Visualisations for all website pages: Creation of brand visual language based on the selected logo, brand story, archetype and concepts, will include illustrations, diagram language, icons etc,
Time estimation: 120 work hours; Scope of hours:
hours per week of Website Design services.
Design of social media imagery based on the branding and visual language designed (5)

-Brand Kit with all brand elements, pallets, logo variation, color scheme, icons, typography-fonts, patterns, , usage guide - this kit is a conclusion of all project elements from the brand design, website design etc. (20 hrs)
Time estimation: 45 work hours; Scope of hours:
hours per week of Other Branding Materials services.
Design Services included in the scope:
-Create a coherent set of wireframes and flow of the site done with wire framing	software (Balsamiq Mockups) compatible with Web/Browser design
patterns, this section is done after we get the main content of features and sections (textual)
-Creation of colour scheme and visual concept directions based on the brand story
-we will create 2-3 visualisation elements and focus on the best one
-creation of custom icons and elements based on the graphic language
-Graphic design of all website screens based on the designed brand identity and graphic direction and graphic language as designed on section 1 and site content delivered by the client.
design will take into account deferent screen sizes (responsive design) so it will look perfect on desktop and mobile phone resolutions.
-We deliver the site design in two views, one for desktop and one for mobile phones, if needed we can also provide middle break-points
All design elements are designed in scalable vector formats allowing scalability and reuse.
Our services in this area include the following:
GUI design of all site modules and pages, UI components, all relevant component states, custom icons, graphs, visualisation elements illustrations etc.
Preparation of design files for development:
Preparation of design style guide document with all design materials, comments and functional descriptions (fonts, sizes, margins, colors etc…) in “zeplin” application.
Work hour Price: 230 NIS (not including VAT)
-Total estimated time for project scope: 245 work hours
-For fixed price of the estimation we add 10% to the hour estimation.

-We deliver all detailed design items to the client for approval - the client has up to two rounds of changes to each item, after that iteration more updates/changes (serious once- not typo’s etc) will be quoted separately - and approved with the client first.
-we can start working on the project 7-10 workdays after approval of this quote and it will take us around
-We ask for 40% Downpayment upon signing of the job contract. (not relevant if working on hourly base)
- remaining payment will be made after the client has excepted all approved design materials and website development.
-All added cost for licensing graphic materials such as
will be paid by the client, after approval.
-All tasks that are not detailed in this quote will be quoted separately or charged by the hour (230 nis)

-Once the work is completed, all copyrights pertaining to the project products shall belong to the client alone, prototype studio will sign a release of rights doc transferring the design rights to the client.
Feel free to contact me with all questions or requests.
